subject: Re: [junit] How to avoid running a test class multiple times
msgSnippet: Not as simply as you might think.  Could you achieve what you want with Categories (from 4.8?) David Saff
messageBody:
Not as simply as you might think. Could you achieve what you want
with Categories (from 4.8?)

David Saff

On Wed, Jan 26, 2011 at 5:29 PM, johncortell <john.cortell@...> wrote:
> Is there a way to tell JUnit to execute a class only once no matter how many times it appears in an invoked test suite?
>
> E.g., say SomeTestClass.java is included in both test suite 'A'
> Â and test suite 'B'. But I have a higher-level suite call 'All' which includes both 'A' and 'B'. Running 'All' will thus run SomeTestClass.java twice. Is there a way to prevent that?
>
>
>
